question: Which one of the following upheavals took place in Bengal immediately after the Revolt of 1857?
explanation:
The Indigo revolt was a peasant movement and subsequent uprising of indigo farmers against the indigo planters that arose in Bengal in 1859 just after the Revolt of 1857.
The peasants were compelled to plant Indigo rather than the food Crops. The peasants were provided loans called \"dadon\" for indigo planting which was at a very high interest rate. The loan made the people indebted and resulted in a rebellion. The leaders were Digambar and Bishnu Bishwas.
